structure.unit: ARTICLE CXXXII. COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY BOARD

text.section:
Sec. 2-2045. Terms, reappointment, vacancies and attendance.
Elected officials or designees are not subject to length of terms or limits on consecutive terms and shall serve as long as s/he is in office.
All other members shall serve two-year terms, except that the length of the terms of the initial appointees shall be adjusted to stagger the terms.
A member may be reappointed; however, a member may not serve more than four (4) consecutive terms. A member who has served four (4) consecutive terms is eligible to be appointed again after a two-year hiatus from the Community Action Agency Board.
Vacancies shall be filled in the same manner that initial appointments are filled.
A member may be removed for failure to comply with the attendance requirements set out in Section 2-11.39 of the Code of Miami-Dade County, Florida as amended, or for any other reason as established in the Community Action Agency Board Bylaws.
